{{also|opa|OPA|opá|opâ}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈoːpa/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈɔpa/}} {{a|chiefly western German}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈoːpʰɐ/}} {{a|some speakers from Kiel}}{{cite-journal|author=Mooshammer, Christine|last=Mooshammer|first=Christine|author2=Rathcke, Tamara V|last2=Rathcke|first2=Tamara|title=Opa vs Oper: Neutralization of /ɐ/ and unstressed /a/ contrast in a perception and production study|year=2016|url=https://kar.kent.ac.uk/57990/1/P%26P12_OpaOper_final.pdf|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170719155622/https://kar.kent.ac.uk/57990/1/P%26P12_OpaOper_final.pdf|archivedate=19 July 2017|accessdate=19 July 2017}} * {{audio|de|De-Opa.ogg|Audio}} * {{homophones|de|Oper}} ''ibid'' ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Opas|Opas|Opachen}} # [[grandpa]] # any [[elderly]] [[man]] ====Usage notes==== * The word is commonly used with a definite article in most parts of central Germany, southern Germany, and Austria: ''Wo ist der Opa?'' – "Where is Grandpa?"
